path: /posts/2020 is the year of embracing code

markdownRemark.html:
2020 is the year of embracing code.

My first work experience in high school was learning some Java interning over the summer at a small software company. I learned a lot but decided code wasn’t for me. I felt much more at home making physical stuff so I went to study mechanical engineering instead. I learned, built, and got a masters degree along the way.

Code did keep pulling me back every now and then, while interning for cummins turbo technologies I wrote data analysis scripts in Python as one of the few people in my department who could.

After my masters degree I went into programme (project) management at Aston Martin launching new models. I spent 2 years at Aston Martin and during that time I started taking tutorials on freecodecamp.com to learn fullstack javascript development just as a hobby.

I found a https://news.ycombinator.com/ “who’s hiring?” thread for a programming job, completed a few take home tests and some team-fit calls and now I work for an American start up company that is fully remote! Since September I’ve been writing Javascript everyday at home!

What I’m learning in January

  • ReactJS - which incidentally is how this blog is made.
  • Redux
  • Typescript
